alert.note: Alert for Columbia (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 7:54PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected in the Green Ridge Burn Scar. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Washington, including the following county, Columbia. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 754 PM PDT, At 750 PM, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall of 0.25 to 0.5 inches is expected on top of what fell earlier this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern Columbia County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
